In 1987, Mr Kenneth Baker ( now William Wilberforce Kenneth Baker ) said a national curriculum was needed because we can no longer leave individual teachers, schools or local authorities to devise the curriculum that children should follow. turned consultant Peter Dix answers your questions Q We are hearing a lot about academies and free schools. What are they and what is the difference? A Technically, there is no difference. These new schools will become academies, wrote Michael Gove , the Education Secretary, when he launched the free schools programme in the autumn.
